conclusion: To find the magnitude of the frictional force exerted by the ground on the long wooden board ab, we need to consider the forces acting on both the wooden block P and the board ab.
A wooden block P of mass m slides on a long wooden board ab of mass M.
The coefficient of kinetic friction between the long wooden board ab and the ground is μ1, and the coefficient of kinetic friction between the wooden block P and the long wooden board ab is μ2.

premise: The gravitational force (mg) acts downward on block P.
conclusion: The normal force (N_P) exerted by the board ab upward balances the weight of P, so N_P = mg.

premise: The kinetic frictional force (f_k) between block P and board ab acts opposite to the direction of motion of P.
conclusion: The kinetic frictional force f_k is given by f_k = μ2 N_P = μ2 mg.

premise: The gravitational force (Mg) acts downward on board ab.
conclusion: The normal force exerted by the ground upward balances the combined weight of the board and block P, so it is N_ground = (M + m)g.

premise: The kinetic frictional force f_k exerted by block P on board ab acts to the left.
conclusion: The frictional force f_ground exerted by the ground on board ab acts to the right to balance the frictional force from block P.

premise: The frictional force exerted by block P on board ab (f_k) is μ2 mg to the left.
conclusion: The board ab remains stationary, so the frictional force exerted by the ground on the board (f_ground) must balance this force.

premise: The frictional force exerted by the ground on board ab must balance the force exerted by block P.
conclusion: The magnitude of the frictional force exerted by the ground on the long wooden board ab is μ2 mg.
